data.title: Simple Word Abbreviator
data.solution:
messageIN = input().split(">")
messageOUT = ""

for words in messageIN:

    if "<" not in words:
        messageOUT += words
        continue

    block = words.index("<")
    messageOUT += words[:block]
    abbreviate = words[block+1:].split()

    for word in abbreviate:
        messageOUT += word[0]

print(messageOUT)
data.statement:
You need to abbreviate the given text by replacing every string surrounded by < and > with the appropriate acronym.

An acronym is a word formed from the initial letters of a every word in the original string. 
Example: 
<Crime Scene Investigation> => CSI
<North Atlantic Treaty Organization> => NATO

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testIn: I came first in <International Math Olympiad>, <laugh out loud>
testCases.testOut: I came first in IMO, lol

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn: I came first in <International Science Olympiad Of Greatness>, <laugh out loud>
testCases.testOut: I came first in ISOOG, lol

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn: <what the f***>, I am better then you any-day
testCases.testOut: wtf, I am better then you any-day

testCases.title: Test 3
testCases.testIn: The <Global Environment Facility> makes it easy to see <you only live once>
testCases.testOut: The GEF makes it easy to see yolo

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn: when you <go to hell> you <go to heaven>

testCases.title: Test 4
testCases.testIn: <hyper text markup language> or java perhaps <pant yant tant hant oant nant> or maybe <rugby under bombs yorky>
testCases.testOut: html or java perhaps python or maybe ruby

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn: i have a <Masters Degree> in math and <Bachelor's Degree> in greatness
testCases.testOut: i have a MD in math and BD in greatness

testCases.title: Test 5
testCases.testIn: <laughing out loud> <got to go> <talk to you later> <hope you enjoyed>

testCases.title: Validator 5
testCases.testIn: <some people like> <other people> <but sometimes> <i hate> abbreviations

testCases.title: Test 6
testCases.testIn: <no more spaces><for quite some time><Hopefully N##>

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You need to abbreviate the given text by replacing every string surrounded by < and > with the appropriate acronym.

An acronym is a word formed from the initial letters of a every word in the original string.
Example:
<Crime Scene Investigation> => CSI
<North Atlantic Treaty Organization> => NATO
Input
message
Output
abbreviated_message
Constraints
0 < Length of message < 125
Example
Input
I came first in <International Math Olympiad>, <laugh out loud>
Output
I came first in IMO, lol
